episodeTitle: Transformed into Nami! Bon Clay's Rapid-Fire Ballet Kenpo!
description: Sanji battles Mr. 2 Bon Clay in an intense leg-based fight, overcoming the enemy's shapeshifting advantage. Meanwhile, Vivi prepares to destroy the palace to stop the war, but Crocodile arrives to interfere.

events.title: First Use of Opening Song 'Hikari e'
events.description: Episode 116 debuts the new opening theme 'Hikari e' by The Babystars, which notably shows Nico Robin and Tony Tony Chopper with the crew before their official introductions, serving as a spoiler for future events.
events.significance: Marks a significant change in the anime's presentation and contains notable spoilers by showing future crew members.

events.title: Recap of Chopper and Usopp's Victory
events.description: The episode opens with a recap of Chopper and Usopp's hard-fought victory against the Baroque Works officer team of Mr. 4 and Miss Merry Christmas.
events.significance: Reminds viewers of the ongoing battles across Alubarna and the Straw Hats' progress in defeating Baroque Works.

events.title: Vivi Decides to Destroy the Palace
events.description: Princess Vivi, with Chaka's reluctant agreement, orders the loading of gunpowder to destroy the Alubarna Palace. Her plan is to use the explosion as a signal to both the rebel and royal armies, hoping to unite them against their common enemy.
events.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's willingness to sacrifice her nation's most important symbol to save her people from civil war.

quotes.text: We have to blow up the palace to get everyone's attention!
quotes.speaker: Vivi
quotes.context: Vivi convincing Chaka of the necessity of destroying the palace

events.title: Sanji vs Mr. 2 Bon Clay Intensifies
events.description: The battle between Sanji and Mr. 2 Bon Clay escalates into a full-scale clash of leg-based fighting styles, with both fighters demonstrating their mastery of kick-based martial arts.
events.significance: Showcases one of the most impressive choreographed fights in the Arabasta Arc, highlighting Sanji's combat prowess without Devil Fruit powers or weapons.

events.title: Mr. 2's Ballet Kenpo Techniques Debut
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Clay unleashes a barrage of his signature Okama Kenpo (Ballet Kenpo) techniques including Ballet Chop, Keri Pointe, Mascara Boomerang, Prima, Bombardier, Bombardier Arabesque, and Grand Fouetté variations.
events.significance: Establishes Mr. 2's unique fighting style that combines ballet movements with deadly martial arts.

events.title: Sanji's French-Named Leg Techniques Debut
events.description: Sanji demonstrates multiple new techniques named after cuts of meat in French: Joue Shoot (cheek), Basse Côte (rib), Longe (loin), Tendron (breast), Flanchet (flank), Quasi (rump), Cuisseau (leg), Jarret (shank), Queue (tail), and Veau Shot (veal).
events.significance: Expands Sanji's fighting repertoire and demonstrates his chef-inspired naming convention for his techniques.

events.title: Mr. 2 Transforms into Nami to Exploit Sanji's Weakness
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Clay uses his Mane Mane no Mi powers to transform into Nami, exploiting Sanji's chivalrous nature and inability to harm women. Sanji becomes paralyzed, unable to attack while Mr. 2 wears Nami's face.
events.significance: Reveals a critical weakness in Sanji's character that will continue to impact him throughout the series. Demonstrates the psychological warfare potential of the Mane Mane no Mi.

quotes.text: What's wrong, Sanji? Can't you hit a woman?
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Clay
quotes.context: Mr. 2 taunting Sanji while transformed into Nami

events.title: Sanji's Chivalry Explained
events.description: Through the battle, Sanji's unwavering code of never harming a woman is highlighted and tested to its limits. Even when facing defeat, Sanji cannot bring himself to strike while Mr. 2 wears Nami's appearance.
events.significance: Reinforces Sanji's character-defining trait and the depth of his chivalrous code, establishing it as both a strength and a weakness.

events.title: Spectacular Hand-Stand Kick Exchange
events.description: Sanji and Mr. 2 engage in a breathtaking sequence where both fighters are in constant motion, exchanging kicks. Sanji performs this entirely while standing on his hands, demonstrating incredible balance and leg strength.
events.significance: One of the most visually impressive and well-choreographed fight sequences in the Arabasta Arc, showcasing both fighters' mastery.

events.title: Sanji Discovers Mr. 2's Critical Weakness
events.description: Through careful observation, Sanji realizes that Mr. 2 must revert to his original form to properly execute his Okama Kenpo techniques. The transformation ability and martial arts cannot be used simultaneously.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's tactical intelligence and provides the key to victory in the battle.

quotes.text: I see it now... you have to become yourself to use your ballet techniques!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji discovering the weakness in Mr. 2's fighting style

events.title: Sanji's Clever Deception
events.description: Sanji uses psychological warfare by claiming there's something on Mr. 2's face, causing him to instinctively touch his left cheek, which triggers the transformation reversal back to his original form.
events.significance: Shows Sanji's ability to think strategically in combat, not just rely on brute force.

quotes.text: Hey, you've got something on your face.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji tricking Mr. 2 into touching his face and reverting

events.title: Sanji Defeats Mr. 2 with Veau Shot
events.description: With Mr. 2 forced back into his original form, Sanji delivers the finishing blow with his Veau Shot technique, defeating the Baroque Works officer. Sanji retrieves Usopp's goggles that Mr. 2 had taken.
events.significance: Marks Sanji's victory over a major Baroque Works officer and eliminates one of Crocodile's strongest subordinates from the battle.

events.title: Sanji Shows Respect for Defeated Opponent
events.description: After defeating Mr. 2, Sanji chooses to spare him, acknowledging their fight was evenly matched and expressing gratitude for the good battle.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's honorable nature and respect for worthy opponents, even enemies.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji acknowledging Mr. 2 after their battle

events.title: Crocodile Appears at the Palace
events.description: Just as Vivi and Chaka are about to execute their plan to destroy the palace, Crocodile arrives with the kidnapped King Cobra, interrupting their scheme and creating a dire situation.
events.significance: Escalates the crisis in Alubarna and puts both Vivi's plan and her father in immediate danger from the arc's main antagonist.

events.title: Mr. 1 and Miss Doublefinger Pursue Nami
events.description: The two remaining Baroque Works officer agents, Mr. 1 and Miss Doublefinger, strategically target Nami as 'the weakest first,' pursuing her through the streets of Alubarna while Zoro searches for her.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming battles between Nami vs. Miss Doublefinger and Zoro vs. Mr. 1, two crucial fights in the Arabasta Arc climax.

quotes.text: We'll take out the weakest first!
quotes.speaker: Miss Doublefinger
quotes.context: Explaining their strategy to hunt down Nami

quotes.text: What's wrong, Sanji? Can't you hit a woman?
quotes.speaker: Mr. 2 Bon Clay
quotes.context: Taunting Sanji while transformed into Nami

quotes.text: I see it now... you have to become yourself to use your ballet techniques!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

quotes.text: Hey, you've got something on your face.
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Tricking Mr. 2 into reverting to original form

quotes.text: We have to blow up the palace to get everyone's attention!
quotes.speaker: Vivi

quotes.text: We'll take out the weakest first!
quotes.speaker: Miss Doublefinger

themes.description: The episode explores Sanji's unwavering code of chivalry, which is simultaneously his greatest strength and most exploitable weakness.
themes.symbolism: Sanji's inability to harm women represents traditional knightly values being tested in the harsh reality of pirate combat.
culturalReferences: French culinary tradition in technique names

themes.description: Both Sanji and Mr. 2 demonstrate that tactical thinking and exploiting weaknesses can be more effective than raw power.
themes.symbolism: The battle showcases how psychological warfare and observation can turn the tide of combat.

themes.description: Vivi's willingness to destroy the palace, a symbol of her kingdom, demonstrates the difficult choices leaders must make.
themes.symbolism: The palace represents the old order that must be sacrificed to create a new, unified future for Arabasta.

themes.description: Despite being enemies, Sanji shows respect for Mr. 2's fighting skills and spares him after victory.
themes.symbolism: Demonstrates the One Piece theme that honor can exist even between opposing sides.

characterSpotlights.development: Sanji's character-defining trait of chivalry is both tested and exploited, yet he overcomes through tactical intelligence rather than abandoning his principles.
keyActions: Battles Mr. 2 Bon Clay in intense leg-based combat
Refuses to attack when Mr. 2 transforms into Nami
Uses psychological tactics to force Mr. 2's transformation reversal
Shows mercy and respect to defeated opponent
quotes: I see it now... you have to become yourself to use your ballet techniques!
Hey, you've got something on your face.

characterSpotlights.development: Mr. 2 demonstrates both his cunning use of Devil Fruit powers and his honorable nature as a fighter, earning Sanji's respect despite being enemies.
keyActions: Uses Okama Kenpo techniques against Sanji
Transforms into Nami to exploit Sanji's weakness
Is defeated but shown respect by Sanji
quotes: What's wrong, Sanji? Can't you hit a woman?

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi demonstrates her growth as a leader by making the painful choice to destroy her kingdom's palace for the greater good.
keyActions: Orders the palace to be loaded with gunpowder
Convinces Chaka to support her plan
Prepares to sacrifice the palace to unite the armies
quotes: We have to blow up the palace to get everyone's attention!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the fight choreography between Sanji and Mr. 2, adding additional techniques and the spectacular handstand kick exchange sequence that was not as detailed in the manga.
The opening theme 'Hikari e' debuts in this episode and shows Nico Robin and Chopper as crew members before their official joining, which spoils future story developments.

trivia.fact: This is the first episode to use 'Hikari e' as the opening theme, which would continue for 53 episodes until episode 168.
The opening 'Hikari e' contains significant spoilers by showing Nico Robin alongside the crew and displaying Nami's Clima-Tact one episode before its canonical appearance.
Kazuki Yao, the Japanese voice actor for Mr. 2 Bon Clay, also voices Franky in the series, though the English dub uses different actors for these characters.
Episode 116 adapts portions of three manga chapters: Chapter 188 (pages 4-19), Chapter 189 (pages 2-19), and Chapter 190 (pages 2-10).

The fight between Sanji and Mr. 2 is considered one of the best choreographed battles in the Arabasta Arc, with both fighters relying purely on leg-based combat without weapons or Devil Fruit advantages for Sanji.
All of Sanji's technique names in this episode are French words for cuts of meat, continuing his culinary-themed attack naming convention.

The Mane Mane no Mi's transformation reversal mechanic (touching left cheek) is crucial to the battle's outcome and demonstrates a rare instance of Devil Fruit weaknesses beyond sea water and Seastone.
